description:
Reliance on liquefied natural gas, combined with escalating geopolitical tensions, means that energy costs are unlikely to return to pre-Ukraine war levels any time soon.

The post Why High Energy Bills Are the ‘New Normal’ in Britain appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Why High Energy Bills Are the ‘New Normal’ in Britain

description:
Politics today is a runaway train driven by emotional 'kitsch' rather than reason, turbocharged by tech's global hype machine. Make sure you're sitting close to the emergency exit, says Dr David McGrogan.

The post The Trembling Continuity of an Express: Where Political Kitsch Is Taking Us appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: The Trembling Continuity of an Express: Where Political Kitsch Is Taking Us

description:
Welsh librarians are being urged to avoid "racist" venues and tackle "whiteness" head-on in a £130,000 drive launched by the Welsh Labour Government to address systemic racism.

The post Librarians Being Told Not to Arrange Meetings in “Racist” Buildings appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Librarians Being Told Not to Arrange Meetings in “Racist” Buildings

description:
The authoritarian turn taken by the Labour Government in the past two weeks is a warning to America, says Joshua Trevino. Elect a Harris-Watz administration, and expect the same clamp down on free speech.

The post Britain’s Descent Into Authoritarianism is a Warning to America appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Britain’s Descent Into Authoritarianism is a Warning to America

description:
Energy bills are expected to climb by nearly £150 later this year, a rise that will not only add strain to household budgets but also affect millions of pensioners facing the loss of their winter fuel payments.

The post Energy Tariffs Set to Surge As Winter Fuel Payment Axed for Many Pensioners appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Energy Tariffs Set to Surge As Winter Fuel Payment Axed for Many Pensioners

description:
The highest temperature of the year was recorded by the Met Office just yards from a massive heat-generating electricity sub-station, reports Chris Morrison, the Daily Sceptic's Environment Editor.

The post Met Office Records Hottest Day of the Year at a Weather Station Next to a Massive Heat-Generating Electricity Sub-Station appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Met Office Records Hottest Day of the Year at a Weather Station Next to a Massive Heat-Generating Electricity Sub-Station

description:
How long will it be before the All Party Parliamentary Group on British Muslims' definition of 'Islamophobia', which prohibits *any* criticism of Islam, is universally adopted by public institutions? asks Steven Tucker.

The post Saying the Unsayable About Islam (While We Still Can) appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Saying the Unsayable About Islam (While We Still Can)

description:
A summary of the most interesting stories in the past 24 hours that challenge the prevailing orthodoxy about the ‘climate emergency’, public health ‘crises’ and the supposed moral defects of Western civilisation.

The post News Round-Up appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: News Round-Up
